The Expansion of the East Indian Company

The East India Company seeks to extend its reach across Asia, promising greater trade and influence for Britain. This expansion could secure vital resources and strengthen control, but may also provoke local unrest and rivalries with other powers. Should the government support the Company's ambitions or limit its growing power?
The Edward Hyde Plan
Edward Hyde secretly rallies royalists across the kingdom, plotting a counter-revolution to restore the Stuart monarchy. As discontent grows under parliamentary rule, the time to strike draws near.

Subjugate the Iroquois Lands

The time has arrived to assert dominance over the Iroquois Confederacy and expand our influence in North America. By subjugating their lands, we will secure valuable territory and resources, solidifying our presence in the New World and ensuring our power over the vast and untamed frontier.
The British Unification
The time has come to unite England, Scotland, and Wales under one crown. This union will forge a powerful British kingdom, united in strength and spirit. A new era of unity and greatness begins.
Claim the Silesian Crown
With Austria’s influence fading, it's time to press a rightful claim to the crown of Silesia. Securing this key region will strengthen influence and open new opportunities in Central Europe.
Restore the Klein-Venedig
The opportunity arises to revive the Klein-Venedig colony in South America, enhancing trade and signaling a return to overseas expansion.
The Black Eagle

In a bold move to solidify its power and unify the lands of Prussia under a single banner, Brandenburg launches "The Black Eagle" initiative. By annexing Prussia, Brandenburg strengthens its military and political influence in the Baltic, taking a decisive step toward becoming a dominant force in Central and Eastern Europe. With the black eagle as its symbol, the newly unified state will rise to challenge the great powers of the continent.
Operation Nouvelle Espagne: Franco-Spanish Harmony

As France and Spain vie for dominance in Europe, the Spanish monarchy sees an opportunity to create a lasting bond between the two nations. By embracing French culture within the Iberian court, Spain seeks to foster unity and consolidate control over French territories. This bold move will merge two of Europe's greatest traditions, forming a Franco-Iberian Union that extends Spain’s reach deeper into French lands, while harnessing the cultural and intellectual might of both nations.
